snippet: John Re, 54, faces up to 20 years in prison for selling paintings and sketches purportedly by famous artists. He stole about $2.5 million from unwitting buyers.
abstract: John Re of East Hampton, accused of selling dozens of fake paintings and sketches purported to be by famous artists, pleads guilty in federal court to wire fraud; faces up to 20 years in prison.
lead_paragraph: John Re, 54, faces up to 20 years in prison for selling paintings and sketches purportedly by famous artists. He stole about $2.5 million from unwitting buyers.

headline.main: Seller of Art Fakes Pleads Guilty to Wire Fraud
headline.print_headline: Seller of Art Fakes Pleads Guilty to Wire Fraud
